advisory.name: RLSA-2022:7447
advisory.synopsis: Moderate: pcs security, bug fix, and enhancement update
advisory.topic:
An update for pcs is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisory.description:
The pcs packages provide a command-line configuration system for the Pacemaker and Corosync utilities.
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Rocky Linux 8.7 Release Notes linked from the References section.

fixes.description: [RFE] Provide easier management of constraints created by pcs move command
pcs booth ticket add does not recognize mode option
booth: pcs should validate ticket names
booth: pcs should check that '/etc/booth' exists
[RFE] Provide method to export commands to create all resources
[RFE] Provide method to export commands to create all fence devices
Prevent fence_sbd in combination with stonith-watchdog-timeout>0
A user that is not authorized to run "pcs status" is able to get "pcs status" output anyhow
[RFE] Provide a way to add a scsi **mpath** fencing device to a cluster without requiring a restart of all cluster resources
man pcs suggests using 'stickiness' instead of 'resource-stickiness' in 'pcs resource meta'
CVE-2022-1049 pcs: improper authentication via PAM
[Web-UI] It is not possible to enable SBD using web UI
